transportAdvice: Nantes has an efficient public transit network including trams, buses, and a river ferry, which together cover the main tourist areas well. The historic city centre is compact and very walkable, and taxis are readily available throughout the city.

weather.description: Cold and frequently wet with overcast skies, typical of an Atlantic winter.
Still cool and rainy but with occasional brighter spells as winter begins to ease.
Mild temperatures arrive with a mix of sun and showers as spring gets underway.
Pleasant spring weather with longer days, though rain remains a regular possibility.
Warm and generally agreeable with a good balance of sunshine and occasional showers.
Comfortably warm and increasingly sunny, making it a pleasant time to explore the city.
Warm summer weather with long sunny days and relatively little rainfall.
Similar to July, with warm temperatures and mostly dry conditions ideal for outdoor sightseeing.
Early autumn brings mild temperatures and a gradual return of more frequent rain.
Noticeably cooler with increasing cloud cover and rain as autumn settles in.
Wet and grey with temperatures dropping steadily toward winter levels.
Cold and damp with short days, though festive Christmas markets brighten the city centre.
